definition: open sluice gate/(toll) station/boarding gate (airport etc)/(fig.) gateway (access point)
area in the Shangcheng district of Hangzhou
gear/brake/sluice/lock (on waterway)/electric switch or circuit breaker
old variant of 閘|闸[zha2]/sluice/lock (on waterway)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Three guys died. When they got to the pearly gates.
sentences.chinese: 三个人死后，当他们到了浅蓝色的闸口。

sentences.english: Roundtrip transfer between Kinabalu Park HQ & Gate.
sentences.chinese: 来回神山公园总部至登山闸口之接送。

sentences.english: There are usually lots of small fish at the water-gate.
sentences.chinese: 闸口往往会聚集许多小鱼。

sentences.english: As per the plan, the new gatehouse is scheduled for completion by this October.
sentences.chinese: 根据计划，新闸口将于今年的十月份竣工。

definition: gear/brake/sluice/lock (on waterway)/electric switch or circuit breaker
old variant of 閘|闸[zha2]/sluice/lock (on waterway)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
